sentences.sContent: They took a blood sample to test for hepatitis.
sentences.sCn: 他们取了血样做肝炎化验。

sentences.sContent: ...which was of a nationally representative sample...
...prompting viewers to press a button to request a free sample or order a catalogue...
...most American universities insist that students sample natural and social sciences...
...who looked at a large sample of people over a month-long period...
...applicants only had to submit a sample of their school papers to show their writing ability...
...an admissions committee was content to ask for a sample of applicants' school papers to assess their writing ability...

trans.tranOther: a small part or amount of something that is examined in order to find out something about the whole

trans.tranOther: to taste food or drink in order to see what it is like
